title: Putin's Warning About the War in Ukraine
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that if peace talks fail, Russia will try to take more land in Ukraine. He spoke at a meeting with military leaders. Putin wants Ukraine and its Western friends to agree to Russia's demands in the talks. If they don't, he says Russia will use its army to get what it wants. He talked about areas in Ukraine that Russia has already taken and wants to keep. Putin also said Russia's army is strong and has new weapons. At the same time, peace talks are happening between Ukraine, America, and Europe. Ukraine's leader, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, is working on a peace plan but disagrees with some of Russia's demands. This is about a big conflict that started when Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022.

background_read: The conflict between Russia and Ukraine began in 2022 when Russia invaded Ukraine. This is a big war where many people have been hurt, and countries around the world are trying to help stop it. Peace talks are meetings where leaders from different countries discuss how to end the fighting. Russia wants to keep some areas of Ukraine that it has taken, while Ukraine wants to protect its land and people. Understanding this helps us see why Putin's warning is important for peace.

WHAT: Putin warned that Russia will take more Ukrainian land if peace talks fail
WHERE: In Ukraine and at a meeting in Russia
WHY: Because Russia wants its demands met in the peace talks
